sim.author: Anders Gidenstam
sim.long-description: USS Monitor was one of the first ironclad warships and also one of the very first with its guns in a rotating armoured turret. It was designed by the Swedish-American engineer and inventor John Ericsson and built to a government contract in not much more than a hundered days during the autumn and winter 1861. The 54 meter long ship was powered by a 320 indicated hp steam engine and carried two 11 in smoothbore Dahlgren guns in its revolving gun turret.
